text: We will arguments next in National Society of Engineers against the United States.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the court.
Anything from preventing him from asking two engineers to embark on this process at the same time?
It is impractical Mr. Chief Justice, it has been found that it does not work just it is like trying to conduct a private discussion with two people.
But if he does not like the first engineers estimates, he certainly-- you have already said then he can try again
He is free to negotiate with second or third or fourth or fifth as many as his patience will sustain.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
What about simultaneous conversations, Mr. Loevinger?

Mr. Justice White, I think the difficulty with simultaneous conversations is that they are little bit like simultaneous consultations with the doctors, it is very difficult to see how you could get simultaneous--
The engineers considered impractical Mr. Justice White, they consider simultaneous that their stepping on each others stone --
